title: Fairly heavy rains expected in parts of the island
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle, Matara and Puttalam districts today (15), the Department of Meteorology says.

title: Israeli airstrikes in Gaza kill 70 people, including 22 children, health officials say
byline: Israeli airstrikes pounded northern and southern Gaza on Wednesday, killing at least 70 people, including almost two dozen children, according to hospitals and health officials, a day after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said there was “no way” he would halt Israel’s offensive in the Palestinian territory before Hamas is defeated.

title: Luxury vehicles of Presidential Secretariat to be auctioned today
byline: A total of 26 vehicles including luxury and decommissioned vehicle models are scheduled to be auctioned today (15), as part of the second phase of the vehicle auction conducted by the Presidential Secretariat.

title: 12 arrested over fertilizer fraud in Polonnaruwa
byline: Twelve individuals have been arrested by the Polonnaruwa Divisional Crimes Unit for allegedly aiding and abetting the sale of ammonia fertilizer falsely marketed as urea fertilizer at higher prices to farmers.

title: Will govern all LG bodies won by NPP, President asserts
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake affirmed that the National People’s Power (NPP) will establish administrative control in all local government bodies where the party has secured victory, stressing the importance of respecting the people’s mandate.

title: 5.9-magnitude earthquake hits off eastern Indonesia, no tsunami alert issued
byline: An earthquake measuring 5.9 on the Richter scale jolted off Indonesia’s eastern Maluku province on Thursday morning (15), without triggering large waves, the country’s Meteorology, Climatology and Geophysics Agency said.

title: 38 persons apprehended for engaging in illegal fishing
byline: A total of 38 individuals involved in various illegal fishing activities have been apprehended in a series of search operations conducted by the Sri Lanka Navy with the assistance of Fisheries Inspectors.

title: Political parties notified to submit LG member lists this week
byline: The Election Commission of Sri Lanka has requested all political parties and independent groups to submit details of the members elected to local government institutions by the end of this week.

title: 965 killed in road accidents in 5 months this year
byline: A total of 965 individuals have died in road accidents across the country this year.

title: Another motor accident in Talawakelle
byline: A motor vehicle traveling at high speed from Nuwara Eliya to Talawakelle has met with an accident after crashing into an embankment along the main road Lindula.

title: Sri Lanka, India’s EXIM Bank signs debt restructuring agreements worth USD 930mn
byline: The bilateral amendatory agreements have been signed between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Export - Import Bank (EXIM) of India pertaining to the Line of Credits and Buyer’s Credit Loan Agreements under the External Debt Restructuring Process of Sri Lanka.

title: Cut-price Magna Carta ‘copy’ now believed genuine
byline: A manuscript once considered an unofficial “copy” of the Magna Carta is now believed to be a genuine version and ‘‘one of the world’s most valuable documents’’, according to UK academics.

title: Pre-trial conference fixed for case over death of woman in Welikada Police custody
byline: The Colombo High Court today fixed July 21, 2025, for the pre-trial conference in the case filed against three police officers attached to the Welikada Police in connection with the custodial death of a domestic worker in 2023.

title: Singer-actor The Weeknd reveals he is brainstorming new stage names
byline: The Weeknd is “brainstorming” the end of his stage name. The Blinding Lights hitmaker, whose real name is Abel Tesfaye, has previously expressed a desire to shed his music persona and hinted that his upcoming movie Hurry Up Tomorrow would be his last project under the moniker.

title: Putin, Trump to skip Ukraine’s peace talks that Russian leader proposed
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin indicated they would not attend what could be the first direct peace talks between Moscow and Kyiv in three years on Thursday (15), with the Kremlin sending instead a group of experienced technocrats.

title: Thusitha Halloluwa arrives at CID
byline: Former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board Thusitha Halloluwa has appeared before the Criminal Investigation Department to record a statement.

title: 2024 GCE O/L practical tests to commence next week
byline: Practical tests for the Aesthetics subjects of the G.C.E. Ordinary Level Examination 2024 (2025) will be conducted from May 21 to May 31, 2025, the Department of Examinations has announced.

title: Sri Lankan YouTuber Charith N. Silva features in ‘Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia’ list
byline: Renowned Sri Lankan chef and YouTube content creator Charith N. Silva, known for his popular YouTube channel ‘Wild Cookbook’, has featured in “Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia: The Arts” list for the year 2025 under the Arts (ART & STYLE, FOOD & DRINK) category.

title: First batch of Sri Lankan Hajj pilgrims arrive in Jeddah
byline: The first group of pilgrims from Sri Lanka has landed in Saudi Arabia to perform the annual Hajj pilgrimage.

title: Sri Lankan YouTuber Charith N. Silva features in ‘Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia’ list
byline: Renowned Sri Lankan chef and YouTube content creator Charith N. Silva, known for his popular YouTube channel ‘Wild Cookbook’, has featured in “Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia: The Arts” list for the year 2025 under the Arts (ART & STYLE, FOOD & DRINK) category.

title: India rejects China’s latest renaming of places in Arunachal border state
byline: India said on Wednesday that it rejects China’s move to rename places in the northeastern state of Arunachal Pradesh where the Asian neighbours share a border, adding that the Himalayan territory was an integral part of India.

title: Sri Lankan YouTuber Charith N Silva features in ‘Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia’ list
byline: Renowned Sri Lankan chef and YouTube content creator Charith N. Silva, known for his popular YouTube channel ‘Wild Cookbook’, has featured in “Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia: The Arts” list for the year 2025 under the Arts (ART & STYLE, FOOD & DRINK) category.

title: Sri Lankan YouTuber Charith N Silva features in ‘Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia’ list
byline: Renowned Sri Lankan chef and YouTube content creator Charith N. Silva, known for his popular YouTube channel ‘Wild Cookbook’, has featured in “Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia: The Arts” list for the year 2025 under the Arts (ART & STYLE, FOOD & DRINK) category.

title: Gerandi Ella tragedy: DMT officials inspect bus at Kotmale Police
byline: A group of officials attached to the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) conducted an inspection of the bus which was involved in the tragic accident which claimed the lives of 23 individuals in Gerandi Ella, Ramboda on Sunday (11).

title: Supreme Court now accepts online payments via ‘GovPay’
byline: The Supreme Court of Sri Lanka has officially joined the ‘GovPay’ digital payment platform, enabling online transactions for a range of court services that were previously handled in cash.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued for severe lightning in several provinces.

title: Seven new envoys to Sri Lanka present credentials to President
byline: Seven newly appointed ambassadors to Sri Lanka have presented their credentials to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today (15) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: US donates advanced nuclear detection equipment worth USD 1 million to Sri Lanka Navy
byline: The US Embassy in Colombo has provided state-of-the-art radiation and chemical detection equipment valued at USD 1 million (299 million LKR) to the Sri Lanka Navy, significantly boosting the country’s capacity to detect and respond to nuclear, radiological, and chemical threats in its maritime domain.

title: Former Land Reclamation Corp. chairman granted bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the release on bail of former Chairman of the Sri Lanka Land Reclamation & Development Corporation (SLLRDC), Harshan de Silva, who was arrested by the Bribery Commission.

title: Testimony recorded from mother of Kotahena suicide victim
byline: The recording of evidence related to the suicide of a young girl in Kotahena was held before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (15).

title: SLPP decides not to attend opposition discussion on LG bodies
byline: The SLPP has decided not to attend today’s special meeting to be held among representatives of the opposition parties to discuss ways to establish power within local government bodies, where the NPP does not hold a majority.

title: Who will enter CMC from People’s Alliance?
byline: The name of Deepa Edirisinghe has been proposed for the only seat secured by the People’s Alliance in the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC).

title: TikTok charged with breaching EU online content rules
byline: Social media app TikTok was charged by EU tech regulators on Thursday with breaching EU online content rules, putting its owner ByteDance at risk of a fine of as much as 6% of its global turnover.

title: Station Masters’ Union details reasons for train delays
byline: Train operations have been affected severely due to a number of shortcomings within the Department of Railways, according to the Sri Lanka Railways Station Masters’ Union.

title: Sri Lanka’s new direction must be communicated to the world - President tells new diplomats
byline: It is the responsibility of ambassadors to convey Sri Lanka’s ongoing political transformation to the international community and to elevate the country’s image on the global stage, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has emphasized.

title: National Poson Week declared from June 7-13
byline: The national Poson Week has been declared from June 07 to 13, as decided by the Poson Committee that convened today (15).

title: Cabinet approval to allow import of salt
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the decision to allow the importation of salt for industrial and consumer use until June 10, 2025.

title: Pilleyan files FR petition challenging arrest and detention by CID
byline: Former State Minister Sivanesathurai Chandrakanthan, alias Pilleyan, has filed a Fundamental Rights petition before the Supreme Court through his legal counsel.

title: Probe launched into Harak Kata’s controversial comments to media
byline: The Terrorism Investigation Division (TID) has commenced an investigation into a controversial statement made by high-profile drug trafficking and organized crime suspect Nandun Chinthaka Wickramaratne, alias “Harak Kata,” who is currently detained at the Tangalle Old Prison.

title: Pakistan, India agree to extend ceasefire until May 18: Pakistani FM
byline: Pakistan and India held talks on Thursday and agreed to extend the ongoing ceasefire until May 18, Pakistani Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar said.
